com.ftdichip.ftd2xx
Class Service

java.lang.Object
  com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Service

public final class Service
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class to retrieve and configure connected devices.

Note: There are a set of system properties to initialize a device. The following list shows them with there default values.

Note: Every property's value that is greater than 0 will be used for device initialisation.
Vital properties:

  • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Device.configFile =ftd2xxj.properties // File used to load external settings. May be specified as a full URL.
  • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Device.writeTimeout = 300
  • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Device.readTimeout = 300


Optional properties:

  • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Device.latencyTimer
  • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Device.usbReceiveBufferSize
  • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Device.usbTransmitBufferSize
  • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Device.resetPipeRetryCount


For detailed description of the values see the ftd2xxj API.

Author:
Mike Werner
See Also:
Device

Method Detail

listDevices

public static Device[] listDevices()
                            throws FTD2xxException
Lists all currently attached devices.

Returns:
All connected devices. If no device is connected an empty array will be returned.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the information cannot be retrieved.

listDevicesByType

public static Device[] listDevicesByType(DeviceType type)
                                  throws FTD2xxException
Lists all devices of a particular type.

Parameters:
type - the type to search for.
Returns:
the list of devices found.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the devices can not be listed.

                                         throws FTD2xxException
Lists all devices which match a particular product description.

Parameters:
description - the description to search for.
Returns:
the devices found.
Throws:
FTD2xxException - if FTD2xx API can not be accessed.

startInputTask

                    throws FTD2xxException
Starts the input task of a device.

Parameters:

Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the input task can not be started (e.g. it is already started).

Throws:
FTD2xxException - if the input task can not be stopped (e.g. it is already stopped).
